alert.note: Alert for Dallas; Madison; Polk; Warren (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 11 at 4:57AM CDT by NWS DesMoines
info.description: ...Strong wind will impact portions of Polk, northern Madison, Dallas and northern Warren Counties through 545 AM CDT... At 456 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking showers and thunderstorms along a line extending from Woodward to near Adel to near Stuart. Movement was southeast at 65 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Granger and De Soto around 500 AM CDT. Waukee, Grimes, Polk City, Van Meter, Saylorville Lake and Big Creek Lake around 505 AM CDT. West Des Moines, Clive, Winterset, Saylorville, Jordan Creek Town Center and Valley West Mall around 510 AM CDT. Des Moines, Ankeny, Norwalk and Des Moines Int`l Airport around 515 AM CDT. Altoona, Carlisle, Bondurant, Prairie Meadows, Adventureland Amusement Park, Avenue Of The Saints Event Center and Southridge Mall around 520 AM CDT. Indianola and Mitchellville around 525 AM CDT. Other locations impacted by these storms include Bevington, Spring Hill, Martensdale, Ackworth, Patterson, Cumming, Weh-Weh-Neh-Kee State Park, Badger Creek State Park, Walnut Woods State Park and Big Creek State Park. This includes the following highways... Interstate 35 between mile markers 52 and 72, and between mile markers 87 and 101. Interstate 80 between mile markers 97 and 149. Interstate 235 between mile markers 1 and 14. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 800 AM CDT for central and south central Iowa.
